title: Babyface Snub At Grammy Awards Goes Viral After Interview Gets Cut Off In Favor Of Chappell Roan
description: Babyface got snubbed at the 2025 Grammy Awards in favor of Chappell Roan, and the moment went viral. Midway through an interview with the AP, the Grammy winner was cut off to interview the “Good Luck, Babe” singer. As Babyface was talking to reporters, one of the reporters noticed Chappell Roan was behind them, waiting […]
author: Armando Tinoco
excerpt: Babyface got snubbed at the 2025 Grammy Awards in favor of Chappell Roan, and the moment went viral.
text: Babyface got snubbed at the 2025 Grammy Awards in favor of Chappell Roan, and the moment went viral. Midway through an interview with the AP, the Grammy winner was cut off to interview the “Good Luck, Babe” singer. As Babyface was talking to reporters, one of the reporters noticed Chappell Roan was behind them, waiting to get interviews. The reporter calls out the “Hot To Go” singer by name a couple of times, and Babyface turns around and tells the reporters, “You guys want to… go do that.” Babyface gives the microphone back to the reporters while they apologize to him and greet Chappell Roan. Many fans on social media have dinged the moment as unprofessional and disrespectful to Babyface. Watch on Deadline Chappell Roan is nominated for six Grammy Awards, including Best New Artist, Record of the Year, Song of the Year, Best Pop Solo Performance, Album of the Year, and Best Pop Vocal Album. RELATED: How To Watch Sunday’s Grammy Awards Online & On TV Chappell Roan has also been confirmed to perform at the Grammys. Other performers to hit the stage include Benson Boone, Shakira, Billie Eilish, Charli XCX, Doechii, Raye, Shaboozey, Teddy Swims, and Sabrina Carpenter. RELATED: Lady Gaga & Bruno Mars To Perform L.A. Tribute During Grammys Trevor Noah is set to host the Grammys live from the Crypto.com Arena in LA for the fifth consecutive time. Presenters throughout the night include Taylor Swift, Gloria Estefan, Will Smith, Cardi B, Queen Latifah, SZA, Olivia Rodrigo, Anthony Kiedis, Chad Smith, and Victoria Monét. Watch the moment down below.
html:
Babyface got snubbed at the 2025 Grammy Awards in favor of Chappell Roan, and the moment went viral.

Midway through an interview with the AP, the Grammy winner was cut off to interview the “Good Luck, Babe” singer.

As Babyface was talking to reporters, one of the reporters noticed Chappell Roan was behind them, waiting to get interviews. The reporter calls out the “Hot To Go” singer by name a couple of times, and Babyface turns around and tells the reporters, “You guys want to… go do that.”

Babyface gives the microphone back to the reporters while they apologize to him and greet Chappell Roan.

Many fans on social media have dinged the moment as unprofessional and disrespectful to Babyface.

Watch on Deadline

Chappell Roan is nominated for six Grammy Awards, including Best New Artist, Record of the Year, Song of the Year, Best Pop Solo Performance, Album of the Year, and Best Pop Vocal Album.

RELATED: How To Watch Sunday’s Grammy Awards Online & On TV

Chappell Roan has also been confirmed to perform at the Grammys. Other performers to hit the stage include Benson Boone, Shakira, Billie Eilish, Charli XCX, Doechii, Raye, Shaboozey, Teddy Swims, and Sabrina Carpenter.

RELATED: Lady Gaga & Bruno Mars To Perform L.A. Tribute During Grammys

Trevor Noah is set to host the Grammys live from the Crypto.com Arena in LA for the fifth consecutive time. Presenters throughout the night include Taylor Swift, Gloria Estefan, Will Smith, Cardi B, Queen Latifah, SZA, Olivia Rodrigo, Anthony Kiedis, Chad Smith, and Victoria Monét.

Watch the moment down below.
